title.narrative: H.L. Education for Peace - The Geneva Initiative

description.narrative: The Geneva Initiative is an Israeli NGO working alongside its Palestinian partner the Ramallah-based Palestinian Peace Coalition (PPC) ? the Geneva Initiative to advance the cause of peace and to create the necessary environment for a viable two-state solu tion. The Israeli and Palestinian founders of the Geneva Initiative negotiated the Geneva Accord in 2003 a detailed model peace accord based on the two-state solution. Operating in three major fields ? peace education policy analysis and advocacy.Strengthe ning the Infrastructure for Peace and Reconciliation: Engaging Palestinian and Israeli Youth project is grounded in joint approach and will strive to present a different regional reality combat growing de-legitimization of the other side and of the two-sta te solution by providing reconciliation training for a cohort of influential young leaders. The programme will equip young 100 Palestinian and Israeli leaders (50 women and 50 men) with knowledge tools and experience to recognize the pain losses and narrat ives of the other side that will help to mitigate the current violent and tense reality but also work towards building a constituency in support of peace. The project?s overall goal is to promote the viability of the two-state solution and enhance the cond itions for a sustainable resolution to the conflict and by strengthening young Palestinian and Israeli leaders? belief engagement and willingness to advance a reconciliation process between peoples through a process that creates meaningful channels for tru st building dialogue and advocacy. The project?s specific outcomes are: to increase levels of trust understanding and tolerance between young Palestinian and Israeli leaders and reduce levels of fear and hostility towards the other side and to raise discou rse about reconciliation transitional justice and peace.
